title: Introduction to ESTC 2009

author: Hannes A. Schwetz, Austria Wirtschaftsservice Gesellschaft

segmentation: See innovation Seed came 2009.
Here behind this contest is clearly to promote entrepreneurship in the field of semantic.
Technologies, that's what we are all here for.
I like to really welcome all the startups who participate in Dementors.
Wish all of us interesting.
Session isn't driving pictures.
Today Huawei are we doing this?
Besides all the Dobie, guarded discussed before?
How to get to the customers startups face quite some challenges.
One of them I personally like to call the visibility issue because how do you get employees for your starter?
How you get customers?
How you attract investors?
How does anyone just simply see you that you're out there is all the great things you're doing?
One that different ways to address these issues?
Well, you can have a lucky punch.
You know someone just discovers you like PhD students made a nice work in Israel and was just discovered by Google.
Great, but however often does that really happen.
You can wait, their customers, realize how changes your product are and just come to you while not so likely that will happen.
Just trust any good product or among other things you can attend startup competitions like just this one here.
How does it work?
This is the service instance of the startup competition we have been doing here.
We are constantly growing so we are very happy to see ever increasing amount of applications and not only applications but also the quality is constantly rising.
We have quite some different countries from a pictures from all the world will see we tried to organize the pitch rather straightforward so everyone should have the times same time slot to compete.
7 minutes each so we will be rather strict on that.
So the really give everyone a fair chance and the same amount of spot to present the pitch is how will it work.
We have clear criteria and how to charge will be innovation, business model Horse.
The markets in the team and finally also do presentation.
How does each and every company present here?
How is the fit really working?
We have.
Quite some mantras here.
I will introduce him a bit later.
They all have some schemas in front of them where they will give you some numbers for the pictures.
So that's one and two or four and five.
We want to avoid to some middle marks that leads to overall ranking.
We will have a little session in the afternoon with Dementors and assure members to rethink this valuation because only in the afternoon we have seen all of the pictures.
So everyone should have a chance to possibly really evaluate some some comments they had and some marks they want to make.
That leads to the final ranking.
The winners we will announce this evening at social event at the Belmont House.
It's not only a great location, but I think it will be also nice for the defenders to receive some prices here.
Here can see last year's winners.
I think they look rather excited, so I think it's really obvious of pleasure to win a competition like this.
And for sure, there's money to win for the companies involved.
We have a huge huge range of mentis.
Almost all of them could come.
I think John Prima comp is very sorry he couldn't attend.
Today we have assembled.
We seize which are very interesting.
I think for the companies to get in touch with.
We have business Angels here.
We have to meteor here.
We have public investors here and we have founders here and Additionally also industry.
So there's really a wide wide range of mentors who will do the charging.
So I think all the different aspects.
Which are relevant SuccessFactors for company can be covered today.
For the first time also we have this afternoon mentoring sessions for the startups.
The matchmaking is done so right after the lunch.
I think it will be announced at the reception area so the startups can see and Dementors, which matches have been made.

So that gives the startup stupidity to get rather directly in touch with the seasoned media and investors to ask him questions to get feedback however they wanted, just to have very very straight excess, which is regularly maybe a bit more difficult to get so.
Use those those moments for this from the mentors and with that also already a big thanks for the mentors for giving their time for the startups to support him.
It's very, very important, especially in the early phase for young driving companies.
This is the time frame.
We're bit late, but it's going to work very well.
I don't don't worry about that.
Winner will be announced in the evening.
There is also little price for sure not only the money which is counting but also do you need a bit of a symbol to take along?
Uh, down, so there are different interests in all this.
Activities I think the startups they want visibility want feedback for sure.
I want to win, that's here.
Also remain important thing mentors.
I guess they want to donate some of their experience to the startups.
They also want to see what's going on in the markets.
It's also very interesting.
Hope for them.
And from our side I'm investment manager at AWS.
It's the Austrian Economics Service variants invest in startup.
We have also the interest to support startups in Austria for sure.
But I think we have some rather interesting instruments for very very young companies.
And one of the instruments are just like to show you briefly to give in a short idea what we do.
200,000 euros from the AWF.
It's always the same these videos you have always a bit of a challenge to start them properly.
OK, so that's not working.
We don't want technology to stop us from going ahead.
All I wanted to say is we start with 100,000 or 200,000 K for very early startups and can go up to 1 million euros.
So if you have interesting startup and you also like Australia.
You're welcome, do to get in touch with us, but that's our motivation is to support this competition for assert instance.
The competition for this money from our side is very fierce.
As fierce as I expect also to be the competition to be now, which is starting right now for the prices for this year.
Seed innovation camp.
And with that I'd like to say thank you for your attention and ask you first thing to come on stage.
It's from the Free University of Berlin, Mrs Allegre.
Mrs Olga.
Sorry for name.
